030package squidpony.squidmath;
031
032import java.io.Serializable;
033
034/**
035 * A wide range of noise functions that can all be called from one configurable object. Originally from Jordan Peck's
036 * FastNoise library, hence the name (these functions are sometimes, but not always, very fast for noise that doesn't
037 * use the GPU). This implements Noise2D, Noise3D, Noise4D, Noise5D, and Noise6D, and this is the fastest continuous
038 * noise algorithm in the library. It also allows the most configuration of any noise generator here, and the API is
039 * quite large. Some key parts to keep in mind:
040 * <ul>
041 *     <li>The noise type, set with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}, controls what algorithm this uses to generate noise, and
042 *     affects most of the other options. Choose a "_FRACTAL" noise type like {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} (the default) if
043 *     you want to use any of the fractal options, like octaves, lacunarity, gain, or fractal type.</li>
044 *     <li>The frequency, set with {@link #setFrequency(float)}, affects how quickly significant changes in output can
045 *     occur over a given span of input values. It defaults to {@code 1f/32f}, though you should try setting this to
046 *     {@code 1f} if results look strange.</li>
047 *     <li>If your noise type is one of the fractal varieties ({@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL},
048 *     {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}, or {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL}):
049 *     <ul>
050 *         <li>Fractal noise can set a fractal type with {@link #setFractalType(int)}, which defaults to {@link #FBM}
051 *         (almost the same as {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Layered2D}), and can also be set to
052 *         {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} (almost the same as {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Ridged2D}) or {@link #BILLOW}
053 *         (related to RIDGED_MULTI in some ways). The noise type affects how the other fractal options work, and has a
054 *         very strong effect on the appearance of the noise when it changes.</li>
055 *         <li>Octaves, set with {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, are how many "layers" of noise this will calculate on
056 *         each call to get fractal noise. Each octave has its frequency changed based on lacunarity (set with
057 *         {@link #setFractalLacunarity(float)}), and contributes a different amount to the resulting value, based on
058 *         gain (set with {@link #setFractalGain(float)}). Generally, more octaves result in more detail and slower
059 *         generation times. {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} and {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL} only really look like noise when they
060 *         use more than one octave.</li>
061 *         <li>Lacunarity may occasionally need adjustment, but usually you're fine with setting it to 2.0 or 0.5, with
062 *         the appearance informing the decision. I think lacunarity means something related to the width of a crescent,
063 *         and refers to the exponential shape of a graph of frequency as octaves are added. It defaults to 2.0, and you
064 *         can imitate {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.InverseLayered2D} by setting it to 0.5.</li>
065 *         <li>Gain usually only needs changing if lacunarity is changed, but they can be adjusted independently. You
066 *         probably will get the best results if gain is equal to {@code 1f / lacunarity}, or close to that.</li>
067 *     </ul>
068 *     </li>
069 *     <li>In some cases, you may want unusual or symmetrical artifacts in noise; you can make this happen with
070 *     {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, giving it a {@link FlawedPointHash} or a point hash you made, and setting
071 *     noise type to {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} (or {@link #CUBIC}).</li>
072 *     <li>The {@link #CELLULAR} noise type has lots of extra configuration, and not all of it is well-documented, but
073 *     experimenting with settings like {@link #setCellularReturnType(int)} and
074 *     {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)} is a good way to see if it can do what you want.</li>
075 * </ul>
076 */
077public class FastNoise implements Serializable, Noise.Noise2D, Noise.Noise3D, Noise.Noise4D, Noise.Noise5D, Noise.Noise6D {
078    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3L;
079    /**
080     * Simple, very fast but very low-quality noise that forms a grid of squares, with their values blending at shared
081     * edges somewhat.
082     * <br>
083     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/egjotwb.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
084     * <br>
085     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
086     */
087    public static final int VALUE = 0,
088    /**
089     * Simple, very fast but very low-quality noise that forms a grid of squares, with their values blending at shared
090     * edges somewhat; this version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more, but
091     * none of these really disguise the grid it uses.
092     * <br>
093     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/egjotwb.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
094     * <br>
095     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
096     */
097    VALUE_FRACTAL = 1,
098    /**
099     * Also called Gradient Noise or Classic Perlin noise, this is fast and mid-to-low-quality in 2D, but slows down
100     * significantly in higher dimensions while mostly improving in quality. This may have a noticeable grid at 90
101     * degree angles (and a little at 45 degree angles).
102     * <br>
103     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/MO7hwSI.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
104     * <br>
105     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
106     */
107    PERLIN = 2,
108    /**
109     * Also called Gradient Noise or Classic Perlin noise, this is fast and mid-to-low-quality in 2D, but slows down
110     * significantly in higher dimensions while mostly improving in quality. This may have a noticeable grid at 90
111     * degree angles (and a little at 45 degree angles). This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)},
112     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more.
113     * <br>
114     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/MO7hwSI.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
115     * <br>
116     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
117     */
118    PERLIN_FRACTAL = 3,
119    /**
120     * Also called Improved Perlin noise, this is always fast but tends to have better quality in lower dimensions. This
121     * may have a noticeable grid at 60 degree angles, made of regular triangles in 2D.
122     * <br>
123     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wg3kq5A.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
124     * <br>
125     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
126     */
127    SIMPLEX = 4,
128    /**
129     * Also called Improved Perlin noise, this is always fast but tends to have better quality in lower dimensions. This
130     * may have a noticeable grid at 60 degree angles, made of regular triangles in 2D. This version can use
131     * {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more; it is the default noise type if none is
132     * specified.
133     * <br>
134     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wg3kq5A.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
135     * <br>
136     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
137     */
138    SIMPLEX_FRACTAL = 5,
139    /**
140     * Creates a Voronoi diagram of 2D or 3D space and fills cells based on the {@link #setCellularReturnType(int)},
141     * {@link #setCellularDistanceFunction(int)}, and possibly the {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)}. This is
142     * more of an advanced usage, but can yield useful results when oddly-shaped areas should have similar values.
143     * <br>
144     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ScRves7.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
145     * <br>
146     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
147     */
148    CELLULAR = 6,
149    /**
150     * Purely chaotic, non-continuous random noise per position; looks like static on a TV screen.
151     * <br>
152     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/vBtISSx.jpg">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
153     * <br>
154     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
155     */
156    WHITE_NOISE = 7,
157    /**
158     * A simple kind of noise that gets a random float for each vertex of a square or cube, and interpolates between all
159     * of them to get a smoothly changing value (using cubic interpolation, also called {@link #HERMITE}, of course).
160     * If you're changing the point hashing algorithm with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, you should usually use
161     * this or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} if you want to see any aesthetically-desirable artifacts in the hash.
162     * <br>
163     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/foV90pn.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
164     * <br>
165     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
166     */
167    CUBIC = 8,
168    /**
169     * A simple kind of noise that gets a random float for each vertex of a square or cube, and interpolates between all
170     * of them to get a smoothly changing value (using cubic interpolation, also called {@link #HERMITE}, of course).
171     * This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more.
172     * If you're changing the point hashing algorithm with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, you should usually use
173     * this or {@link #CUBIC} if you want to see any aesthetically-desirable artifacts in the hash.
174     * <br>
175     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/foV90pn.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
176     * <br>
177     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
178     */
179    CUBIC_FRACTAL = 9,
180    /**
181     * A novel kind of noise that works in n-dimensions by averaging n+1 value noise calls, all of them rotated around
182     * each other, and with all of the value noise calls after the first adding in the last call's result to part of the
183     * position. This yields rather high-quality noise (especially when comparing one octave of FOAM to one octave of
184     * {@link #PERLIN} or {@link #SIMPLEX}), but is somewhat slow.
185     * <br>
186     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/4ZC9h5t.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
187     * <br>
188     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
189     */
190    FOAM = 10,
191    /**
192     * A novel kind of noise that works in n-dimensions by averaging n+1 value noise calls, all of them rotated around
193     * each other, and with all of the value noise calls after the first adding in the last call's result to part of the
194     * position. This yields rather high-quality noise (especially when comparing one octave of FOAM to one octave of
195     * {@link #PERLIN} or {@link #SIMPLEX}), but is somewhat slow. This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)},
196     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more, and usually doesn't need as many octaves as PERLIN or SIMPLEX to
197     * attain comparable quality.
198     * <br>
199     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/4ZC9h5t.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
200     * <br>
201     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
202     */
203    FOAM_FRACTAL = 11,
204    /**
205     * A simple combination of {@link #SIMPLEX} and {@link #VALUE} noise, averaging a call to each and then distorting
206     * the result's distribution so it isn't as centrally-biased. The result is somewhere between {@link #FOAM} and
207     * {@link #SIMPLEX}, and has less angular bias than Simplex or Value. This gets its name from how it mixes two
208     * different geometric honeycombs (a triangular one for 2D Simplex noise and a square one for 2D Value noise).
209     * <br>
210     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/bMEPiBA.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
211     * <br>
212     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
213     */
214    HONEY = 12,
215    /**
216     * A simple combination of {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} and {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL} noise, averaging a call to each and
217     * then distorting the result's distribution so it isn't as centrally-biased. The result is somewhere between
218     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL}, and has less angular bias than Simplex or Value. This gets
219     * its name from how it mixes two different geometric honeycombs (a triangular one for 2D Simplex noise and a square
220     * one for 2D Value noise). This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and
221     * more, and usually doesn't need as many octaves as PERLIN or SIMPLEX to attain comparable quality, though it
222     * drastically improves with just two octaves.
223     * <br>
224     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/bMEPiBA.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
225     * <br>
226     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
227     */
228    HONEY_FRACTAL = 13;
229
230    /**
231     * Simple linear interpolation. May result in artificial-looking noise.
232     * Meant to be used with {@link #setInterpolation(int)}.
233     */
234    public static final int LINEAR = 0;
235    /**
236     * Cubic interpolation via Hermite spline, more commonly known as "smoothstep".
237     * Can be very natural-looking, but can also have problems in higher dimensions
238     * (including 3D when used with normals) with seams appearing.
239     * Meant to be used with {@link #setInterpolation(int)}.
240     */
241    public static final int HERMITE = 1;
242    /**
243     * Quintic interpolation, sometimes known as "smootherstep".
244     * This has somewhat steeper transitions than {@link #HERMITE}, but doesn't
245     * have any issues with seams.
246     * Meant to be used with {@link #setInterpolation(int)}.
247     */
248    public static final int QUINTIC = 2;
249
250    public static final int FBM = 0, BILLOW = 1, RIDGED_MULTI = 2;
251
252    public static final int EUCLIDEAN = 0, MANHATTAN = 1, NATURAL = 2;
253
254    public static final int CELL_VALUE = 0, NOISE_LOOKUP = 1, DISTANCE = 2, DISTANCE_2 = 3,
255            DISTANCE_2_ADD = 4, DISTANCE_2_SUB = 5, DISTANCE_2_MUL = 6, DISTANCE_2_DIV = 7;
256
257    private int seed;
258    protected float frequency = 0.03125f;
259    protected int interpolation = HERMITE;
260    
261    private int noiseType = SIMPLEX_FRACTAL;
262
263    private int octaves = 1;
264    private float lacunarity = 2f;
265    private float gain = 0.5f;
266
267    private boolean fractalSpiral = false;
268    private int fractalType = FBM;
269
270    private float fractalBounding;
271
272    private int cellularDistanceFunction = EUCLIDEAN;
273    private int cellularReturnType = CELL_VALUE;
274    private FastNoise cellularNoiseLookup;
275    private float gradientPerturbAmp = 1f / 0.45f;
276
277    private float foamSharpness = 1f;
278
279    private IPointHash pointHash = new IntPointHash();
280
281    /**
282     * A publicly available FastNoise object with seed 1337, frequency 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise using
283     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType, 2f lacunarity and 0.5f gain. It's encouraged to use methods that temporarily configure
284     * this variable, like {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(float, float, int)} rather than changing its settings and using a
285     * method that needs that lasting configuration, like {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}.
286     */
287    public static final FastNoise instance = new FastNoise();
288    /**
289     * A constructor that takes no parameters, and uses all default settings with a seed of 1337. An example call to
290     * this would be {@code new FastNoise()}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1
291     * octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
292     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
293     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
294     */
295    public FastNoise() {
296        this(1337);
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * A constructor that takes only a parameter for the FastNoise's seed, which should produce different results for
301     * any different seeds. An example call to this would be {@code new FastNoise(1337)}, which makes noise with the
302     * seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count,
303     * it always uses 1 even for the SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call
304     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain
305     * (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
306     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
307     */
308    public FastNoise(int seed) {
309        this.seed = seed;
310        calculateFractalBounding();
311    }
312    /**
313     * A constructor that takes two parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
314     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
315     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
316     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
317     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
318     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
319     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
320     */
321    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency)
322    {
323        this(seed, frequency, SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
324    }
325    /**
326     * A constructor that takes a few parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
327     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
328     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for 
329     * noiseTypes like SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, but using a fractal noiseType can make sense if you call
330     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
331     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
332     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
333     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
334     */
335    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType)
336    {
337        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * A constructor that takes several parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
342     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
343     * frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
344     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
345     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
346     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
347     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
348     */
349    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves)
350    {
351        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, octaves, 2f, 0.5f);
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * A constructor that takes a lot of parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
356     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4, 0.5f, 2f)}, which makes noise with a
357     * lower frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and the "inverse" effect on how those octaves work (which makes
358     * the extra added octaves be more significant to the final result and also have a lower frequency, while normally
359     * added octaves have a higher frequency and tend to have a minor effect on the large-scale shape of the noise).
360     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
361     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
362     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
363     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
364     * @param lacunarity typically 2.0, or 0.5 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode) 
365     * @param gain typically 0.5, or 2.0 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode)
366     */
367    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves, float lacunarity, float gain)
368    {
369        this.seed = seed;
370        this.frequency = Math.max(0.0001f, frequency);
371        this.noiseType = noiseType;
372        this.octaves = octaves;
373        this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
374        this.gain = gain;
375        calculateFractalBounding();
376    }
377
378    /**
379     * Copy constructor; copies all non-temporary fields from  {@code other} into this. This uses the same reference to
380     * an {@link IPointHash} set with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)} and to another FastNoise set with
381     * {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)}, but otherwise everything it copies is a primitive.
382     * @param other another FastNoise, which must not be null
383     */
384    public FastNoise(final FastNoise other) {
385        this(other.seed, other.frequency, other.noiseType, other.octaves, other.lacunarity, other.gain);
386        this.pointHash = other.pointHash;
387        this.interpolation = other.interpolation;
388        this.gradientPerturbAmp = other.gradientPerturbAmp;
389        this.cellularReturnType = other.cellularReturnType;
390        this.cellularDistanceFunction = other.cellularDistanceFunction;
391        this.cellularNoiseLookup = other.cellularNoiseLookup;
392    }
393
394    protected static float dotf(final float[] g, final float x, final float y) {
395        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y;
396    }
397
398    /**
399     * @return Returns the seed used by this object
400     */
401    public int getSeed() {
402        return seed;
403    }
404
405    /**
406     * Sets the seed used for all noise types, as a long.
407     * If this is not called, defaults to 1337L.
408     * @param seed a seed as a long
409     */
410    public void setSeed(int seed) {
411        this.seed = seed;
412    }
413
414    /**
415     * Sets the frequency for all noise types. If this is not called, it defaults to 0.03125f (or 1f/32f).
416     * This setter validates the frequency, and won't set it to a float less than 0.0001f, which is small enough that
417     * floating-point precision could be an issue. Lots of things may expect this to be higher than the default,
418     * especially code that is meant to be compatible across {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Noise2D} and similar
419     * interfaces; try setting frequency to {@code 1.0f} if you experience issues.
420     * @param frequency the frequency for all noise types, as a positive non-zero float
421     */
422    public void setFrequency(float frequency) {
423        this.frequency = Math.max(0.0001f, frequency);
424    }
425
426    /**
427     * Gets the frequency for all noise types. The default is 0.03125f, or 1f/32f.
428     * @return the frequency for all noise types, which should be a positive non-zero float
429     */
430    public float getFrequency()
431    {
432        return frequency;
433    }
434
435    /**
436     * Changes the interpolation method used to smooth between noise values, using one of the following constants from
437     * this class (lowest to highest quality): {@link #LINEAR} (0), {@link #HERMITE} (1), or {@link #QUINTIC} (2). If
438     * this is not called, it defaults to HERMITE. This is used in Value, Perlin, and Position Perturbing.
439     * @param interpolation an int (0, 1, or 2) corresponding to a constant from this class for an interpolation type
440     */
441    public void setInterpolation(int interpolation) {
442        this.interpolation = interpolation;
443    }

445    /**

579    /**
580     * Returns true if this uses a spiraling rotation as octaves are added to fractal noise.
581     * This mode affects {@link #BILLOW} and {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} fractal types, but not
582     * {@link #FBM}. It changes {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL},
583     * {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL}, and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} noise types, but not
584     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} or {@link #HONEY_FRACTAL} because those show no real improvement
585     * with this on. This mode defaults to false if not set.
586     * @return true if using fractal spiral mode, false otherwise
587     */
588    public boolean isFractalSpiral() {
589        return fractalSpiral;
590    }

592    /**
593     * Sets the fractal spiral mode on or off; if on, this uses a spiraling rotation as octaves are added to
594     * fractal noise. This mode affects {@link #BILLOW} and {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} fractal types, but not
595     * {@link #FBM}. It changes {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL},
596     * {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL}, and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} noise types, but not
597     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} or {@link #HONEY_FRACTAL} because those show no real improvement
598     * with this on. This mode defaults to false if not set.
599     * @param fractalSpiral true to set fractal spiral mode on, false to set it off
600     */
601    public void setFractalSpiral(boolean fractalSpiral) {
602        this.fractalSpiral = fractalSpiral;
603    }

605    /**
606     * Gets the "sharpness" for the {@link #FOAM} and {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} noise types, which is usually
607     * around 0.25f to 2.0f, and defaults to 1.0f. High values produce extreme results more often, and
608     * low values produce mid-range values more often.
609     * @return the current "sharpness" {@link #FOAM} and {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} noise types
610     */
611    public float getFoamSharpness() {
612        return foamSharpness;
613    }
614
615    /**
616     * Only used with {@link #FOAM} and {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} noise types, this affects how often the
617     * noise will produce very high and very low results (more often with high values of foamSharpness),
618     * as opposed to mid-range (more often with low values of foamSharpness).
619     * <br>
620     * This defaults to 1.0f if not set.
621     * @param foamSharpness higher results (above 1) tend to produce extremes, lower results (below 1) produce mid-range
622     */
623    public void setFoamSharpness(float foamSharpness) {
624        this.foamSharpness = foamSharpness;
625    }

627    /**
628     * Gets the point hash, an object implementing {@link IPointHash} that is used to take 2 or more
629     * coordinates and a seed and produce a usually-random-seeming hash value. You may want to use a
630     * flawed IPointHash (one that is not random) for artistic reasons, like
631     * {@link FlawedPointHash.QuiltHash} or {@link FlawedPointHash.CubeHash}, but these mostly work
632     * well when the noise type is {@link #CUBIC} or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}.
633     * <br>
634     * The default setting is an {@link IntPointHash}.
635     * @return the current IPointHash used, such as the default {@link IntPointHash}
636     */
637    public IPointHash getPointHash() {
638        return pointHash;
639    }
640
641    /**
642     * Sets the point hash, an object implementing {@link IPointHash} that is used to take 2 or more
643     * coordinates and a seed and produce a usually-random-seeming hash value. You may want to use a
644     * flawed IPointHash (one that is not random) for artistic reasons, like
645     * {@link FlawedPointHash.QuiltHash} or {@link FlawedPointHash.CubeHash}, but these mostly work
646     * well when the noise type is {@link #CUBIC} or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}.
647     * <br>
648     * The default setting is an {@link IntPointHash}.
649     * @param hash an IPointHash; will be ignored if null
650     */
651    public void setPointHash(IPointHash hash){
652        if(hash != null) this.pointHash = hash;
653    }

814    protected static int fastFloor(float f) {
815        return (f >= 0 ? (int) f : (int) f - 1);
816    }
817
818
819    protected static int fastRound(float f) {
820        return (f >= 0) ? (int) (f + 0.5f) : (int) (f - 0.5f);
821    }
822
823
824    private static float lerp(float a, float b, float t) {
825        return a + t * (b - a);
826    }
827
828
829    protected static float hermiteInterpolator(float t) {
830        return t * t * (3 - 2 * t);
831    }
832
833
834    protected static float quinticInterpolator(float t) {
835        return t * t * t * (t * (t * 6 - 15) + 10);
836    }
837
838    protected static float cubicLerp(float a, float b, float c, float d, float t) {
839        float p = (d - c) - (a - b);
840        return t * (t * t * p + t * ((a - b) - p) + (c - a)) + b;
841    }
842
843    private void calculateFractalBounding() {
844        float amp = gain;
845        float ampFractal = 1;
846        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
847            ampFractal += amp;
848            amp *= gain;
849        }
850        fractalBounding = 1 / ampFractal;
851    }

853    private float valCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y) {
854        return (hashAll(x, y, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
855    }
856
857    private float valCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z) {
858        return (hashAll(x, y, z, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
859    }
860
861    private float valCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w) {
862        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
863    }
864
865    private float valCoord5D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u) {
866        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
867    }
868
869    private float valCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v) {
870        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
871    }

873    protected float gradCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y, float xd, float yd) {
874        final float[] g = grad2f[hash256(x, y, seed)];
875        return xd * g[0] + yd * g[1];
876    }
877
878    protected float gradCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, float xd, float yd, float zd) {
879        final Float3 g = GRAD_3D[hash32(x, y, z, seed)];
880        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z;
881    }
882
883    protected float gradCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd) {
884        final int hash = hash256(x, y, z, w, seed) & 0xFC;
885        return xd * grad4f[hash] + yd * grad4f[hash + 1] + zd * grad4f[hash + 2] + wd * grad4f[hash + 3];
886    }
887
888    protected float gradCoord5D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u,
889                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud) {
890        final Float5 g = grad5f[hash256(x, y, z, w, u, seed)];
891        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z + wd * g.w + ud * g.u;
892    }
893
894    protected float gradCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v,
895                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud, float vd) {
896        final Float6 g = grad6f[hash256(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed)];
897        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z + wd * g.w + ud * g.u + vd * g.v;
898    }

925    /**
926     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
927     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
928     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 2D.
929     * @param x
930     * @param y
931     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
932     */
933    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y) {
934        x *= frequency;
935        y *= frequency;
936
937        switch (noiseType) {
938            case VALUE:
939                return singleValue(seed, x, y);
940            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
941                switch (fractalType) {
942                    case BILLOW:
943                        return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
944                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
945                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
946                    default:
947                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
948                }
949            case FOAM:
950                return singleFoam(seed, x, y);
951            case FOAM_FRACTAL:
952                switch (fractalType) {
953                    case BILLOW:
954                        return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y);
955                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
956                        return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
957                    default:
958                        return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y);
959                }
960            case HONEY:
961                return singleHoney(seed, x, y);
962            case HONEY_FRACTAL:
963                switch (fractalType) {
964                    case BILLOW:
965                        return singleHoneyFractalBillow(x, y);
966                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
967                        return singleHoneyFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
968                    default:
969                        return singleHoneyFractalFBM(x, y);
970                }
971            case PERLIN:
972                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y);
973            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
974                switch (fractalType) {
975                    case BILLOW:
976                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
977                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
978                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
979                    default:
980                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
981                }
982            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:
983                switch (fractalType) {
984                    case BILLOW:
985                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y);
986                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
987                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
988                    default:
989                        return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y);
990                }
991            case CELLULAR:
992                switch (cellularReturnType) {
993                    case CELL_VALUE:
994                    case NOISE_LOOKUP:
995                    case DISTANCE:
996                        return singleCellular(x, y);
997                    default:
998                        return singleCellular2Edge(x, y);
999                }
1000            case WHITE_NOISE:
1001                return getWhiteNoise(x, y);
1002            case CUBIC:
1003                return singleCubic(seed, x, y);
1004            case CUBIC_FRACTAL:
1005                switch (fractalType) {
1006                    case BILLOW:
1007                        return singleCubicFractalBillow(x, y);
1008                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1009                        return singleCubicFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1010                    default:
1011                        return singleCubicFractalFBM(x, y);
1012                }
1013            default:
1014                return singleSimplex(seed, x, y);
1015        }
1016    }

1358    // White Noise
1359
1360    private int floatToIntMixed(final float f) {
1361        final int i = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(f);
1362        return i ^ i >>> 16;
1363    }
1364
1365    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y) {
1366        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1367        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1368
1369        return valCoord2D(seed, xi, yi);
1370    }
1371
1372    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z) {
1373        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1374        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1375        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1376
1377        return valCoord3D(seed, xi, yi, zi);
1378    }
1379    
1380    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1381        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1382        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1383        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1384        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1385
1386        return valCoord4D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi);
1387    }
1388    
1389    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1390        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1391        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1392        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1393        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1394        int ui = floatToIntMixed(u);
1395
1396        return valCoord5D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi, ui);
1397    }
1398
1399    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1400        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1401        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1402        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1403        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1404        int ui = floatToIntMixed(u);
1405        int vi = floatToIntMixed(v);
1406
1407        return valCoord6D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi, ui, vi);
1408    }
1409    
1410    // Value Noise
1411    //x should be premultiplied by 0xD1B55
1412    //y should be premultiplied by 0xABC99
1413    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, int s) {
1414        s += x ^ y;
1415        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1416    }
1417    //x should be premultiplied by 0xDB4F1
1418    //y should be premultiplied by 0xBBE05
1419    //z should be premultiplied by 0xA0F2F
1420    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, int s) {
1421        s += x ^ y ^ z;
1422        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1423    }
1424    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE19B1
1425    //y should be premultiplied by 0xC6D1D
1426    //z should be premultiplied by 0xAF36D
1427    //w should be premultiplied by 0x9A695
1428    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, int s) {
1429        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w;
1430        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1431    }
1432
1433    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE60E3
1434    //y should be premultiplied by 0xCEBD7
1435    //z should be premultiplied by 0xB9C9B
1436    //w should be premultiplied by 0xA6F57
1437    //u should be premultiplied by 0x9609D
1438    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, final int u, int s) {
1439        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w ^ u;
1440        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1441    }
1442
1443    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE95E1
1444    //y should be premultiplied by 0xD4BC7
1445    //z should be premultiplied by 0xC1EDB
1446    //w should be premultiplied by 0xB0C8B
1447    //u should be premultiplied by 0xA127B
1448    //v should be premultiplied by 0x92E85
1449    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, final int u, final int v, int s) {
1450        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w ^ u ^ v;
1451        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1452    }
1453
1454
1455    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y) {
1456        x *= frequency;
1457        y *= frequency;
1458
1459        switch (fractalType) {
1460            case FBM:
1461                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
1462            case BILLOW:
1463                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
1464            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1465                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1466            default:
1467                return 0;
1468        }
1469    }
1470
1471    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
1472        int seed = this.seed;
1473        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y);
1474        float amp = 1;
1475
1476        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1477            x *= lacunarity;
1478            y *= lacunarity;
1479
1480            amp *= gain;
1481            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y) * amp;
1482        }
1483
1484        return sum * fractalBounding;
1485    }
1486
1487    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
1488        int seed = this.seed;
1489        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
1490        float amp = 1;
1491
1492        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1493            if(fractalSpiral){
1494                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
1495                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
1496                x = x2; y = y2;
1497            }
1498            x *= lacunarity;
1499            y *= lacunarity;
1500            amp *= gain;
1501            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1502        }
1503
1504        return sum * fractalBounding;
1505    }
1506
1507    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
1508        int seed = this.seed;
1509        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
1510        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1511            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y));
1512            correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1513            sum += spike * exp;
1514            if(fractalSpiral){
1515                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
1516                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
1517                x = x2; y = y2;
1518            }
1519            x *= lacunarity;
1520            y *= lacunarity;
1521        }
1522        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
1523    }
1524
1525    public float getValue(float x, float y) {
1526        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
1527    }

1529
1530    public float singleValue (int seed, float x, float y) {
1531        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1532        x -= xFloor;
1533        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1534        y -= yFloor;
1535        switch (interpolation) {
1536            case HERMITE:
1537                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1538                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1539                break;
1540            case QUINTIC:
1541                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1542                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1543                break;
1544        }
1545        xFloor *= 0xD1B55;
1546        yFloor *= 0xABC99;
1547        return ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor, seed))
1548                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed)))
1549                * 0x1p-9f;
1550    }
1551
1552    /**
1553     * Produces noise from 0 to 1, instead of the normal -1 to 1.
1554     * @param seed
1555     * @param x
1556     * @param y
1557     * @return noise from 0 to 1.
1558     */
1559    protected float valueNoise (int seed, float x, float y) {
1560        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1561        x -= xFloor;
1562        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
1563        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1564        y -= yFloor;
1565        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
1566        xFloor *= 0xD1B55;
1567        yFloor *= 0xABC99;
1568        return ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor, seed))
1569                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed)))
1570                * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
1571    }
1572    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z) {
1573        x *= frequency;
1574        y *= frequency;
1575        z *= frequency;
1576
1577        switch (fractalType) {
1578            case BILLOW:
1579                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1580            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1581                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1582            default:
1583                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1584        }
1585    }

1590        float amp = 1;
1591
1592        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1593            x *= lacunarity;
1594            y *= lacunarity;
1595            z *= lacunarity;
1596
1597            amp *= gain;
1598            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z) * amp;
1599        }
1600
1601        return sum * fractalBounding;
1602    }

1611                final float x2 = rotateX3D(x, y, z);
1612                final float y2 = rotateY3D(x, y, z);
1613                final float z2 = rotateZ3D(x, y, z);
1614                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2;
1615            }

1618            z *= lacunarity;

1651    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z) {
1652        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1653        x -= xFloor;
1654        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1655        y -= yFloor;
1656        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1657        z -= zFloor;
1658        switch (interpolation) {
1659            case HERMITE:
1660                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1661                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1662                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
1663                break;
1664            case QUINTIC:
1665                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1666                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1667                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
1668                break;
1669        }
1670        //0xDB4F1, 0xBBE05, 0xA0F2F
1671        xFloor *= 0xDB4F1;
1672        yFloor *= 0xBBE05;
1673        zFloor *= 0xA0F2F;
1674        return ((1 - z) *
1675                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor, seed))
1676                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor, seed)))
1677                + z *
1678                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed))
1679                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed)))
1680        ) * 0x1p-9f;
1681    }

1710                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed)))

1873                        + z *
1874                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed))
1875                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))
1876                ))) * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
1877    }
1878
1879    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1880        x *= frequency;
1881        y *= frequency;
1882        z *= frequency;
1883        w *= frequency;
1884        u *= frequency;
1885
1886        switch (fractalType) {
1887            case BILLOW:
1888                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u);
1889            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1890                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u);
1891            default:
1892                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u);
1893        }
1894    }
1895    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1896        int seed = this.seed;
1897        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u);
1898        float amp = 1;
1899
1900        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1901            x *= lacunarity;
1902            y *= lacunarity;
1903            z *= lacunarity;
1904            w *= lacunarity;
1905            u *= lacunarity;
1906            
1907            amp *= gain;
1908            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u) * amp;
1909        }
1910
1911        return sum * fractalBounding;
1912    }
1913
1914    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1915        int seed = this.seed;
1916        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1;
1917        float amp = 1;
1918
1919        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1920            if(fractalSpiral){
1921                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1922                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1923                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1924                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1925                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1926                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
1927            }
1928            x *= lacunarity;
1929            y *= lacunarity;
1930            z *= lacunarity;
1931            w *= lacunarity;
1932            u *= lacunarity;
1933
1934            amp *= gain;
1935            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1936        }
1937
1938        return sum * fractalBounding;
1939    }
1940
1941    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1942        int seed = this.seed;
1943        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
1944        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1945            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u));
1946            correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1947            sum += spike * exp;
1948            if(fractalSpiral){
1949                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1950                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1951                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1952                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1953                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1954                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
1955            }
1956            x *= lacunarity;
1957            y *= lacunarity;
1958            z *= lacunarity;
1959            w *= lacunarity;
1960            u *= lacunarity;
1961        }
1962        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
1963    }
1964
1965    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1966        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency);
1967    }

1969    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1970        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1971        x -= xFloor;
1972        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1973        y -= yFloor;
1974        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1975        z -= zFloor;
1976        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
1977        w -= wFloor;
1978        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
1979        u -= uFloor;
1980        switch (interpolation) {
1981            case HERMITE:
1982                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1983                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1984                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
1985                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
1986                u = hermiteInterpolator(u);
1987                break;
1988            case QUINTIC:
1989                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1990                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1991                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
1992                w = quinticInterpolator(w);
1993                u = quinticInterpolator(u);
1994                break; 
1995        }
1996        //0xE60E3, 0xCEBD7, 0xB9C9B, 0xA6F57, 0x9609D, 0x86D51
1997        xFloor *= 0xE60E3;
1998        yFloor *= 0xCEBD7;
1999        zFloor *= 0xB9C9B;
2000        wFloor *= 0xA6F57;
2001        uFloor *= 0x9609D;
2002        return ((1 - u) *
2003                ((1 - w) *
2004                        ((1 - z) *
2005                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2006                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed)))
2007                                + z *
2008                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2009                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))))
2010                        + (w *
2011                        ((1 - z) *
2012                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2013                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
2014                                + z *
2015                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2016                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
2017                        )))
2018                + (u *
2019                ((1 - w) *
2020                        ((1 - z) *
2021                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2022                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))
2023                                + z *
2024                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2025                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))))
2026                        + (w *
2027                        ((1 - z) *
2028                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2029                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))
2030                                + z *
2031                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2032                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))
2033                        ))))
2034        ) * 0x1p-9f;
2035    }

2037    protected float valueNoise(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
2038        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
2039        x -= xFloor;
2040        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
2041        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
2042        y -= yFloor;
2043        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
2044        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
2045        z -= zFloor;
2046        z *= z * (3 - 2 * z);
2047        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
2048        w -= wFloor;
2049        w *= w * (3 - 2 * w);
2050        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
2051        u -= uFloor;
2052        u *= u * (3 - 2 * u);
2053        //0xE60E3, 0xCEBD7, 0xB9C9B, 0xA6F57, 0x9609D, 0x86D51
2054        xFloor *= 0xE60E3;
2055        yFloor *= 0xCEBD7;
2056        zFloor *= 0xB9C9B;
2057        wFloor *= 0xA6F57;
2058        uFloor *= 0x9609D;
2059        return ((1 - u) *
2060                ((1 - w) *
2061                        ((1 - z) *
2062                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2063                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed)))
2064                                + z *
2065                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2066                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))))
2067                        + (w *
2068                        ((1 - z) *
2069                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2070                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
2071                                + z *
2072                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2073                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))

2079                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))

2189
2190    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2191        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
2192        x -= xFloor;
2193        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
2194        y -= yFloor;
2195        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
2196        z -= zFloor;
2197        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
2198        w -= wFloor;
2199        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
2200        u -= uFloor;
2201        int vFloor = v >= 0 ? (int) v : (int) v - 1;
2202        v -= vFloor;
2203        switch (interpolation) {
2204            case HERMITE:
2205                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
2206                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
2207                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
2208                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
2209                u = hermiteInterpolator(u);
2210                v = hermiteInterpolator(v);
2211                break;
2212            case QUINTIC:
2213                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
2214                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
2215                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
2216                w = quinticInterpolator(w);
2217                u = quinticInterpolator(u);
2218                v = quinticInterpolator(v);
2219                break;
2220        }
2221        //0xE95E1, 0xD4BC7, 0xC1EDB, 0xB0C8B, 0xA1279, 0x92E85
2222        xFloor *= 0xE95E1;
2223        yFloor *= 0xD4BC7;
2224        zFloor *= 0xC1EDB;
2225        wFloor *= 0xB0C8B;

2382                                ((1 - z) *
2383                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed))
2384                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed)))
2385                                        + z *
2386                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed))
2387                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed)))
2388                                ))))))
2389        ) * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
2390    }
2391
2392    // Foam Noise
2393
2394    public float getFoam(float x, float y) {
2395        return singleFoam(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
2396    }
2397
2398    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y) {
2399        final float p0 = x;
2400        final float p1 = x * -0.5f + y * 0.8660254037844386f;
2401        final float p2 = x * -0.5f + y * -0.8660254037844387f;
2402
2403        float xin = p2;
2404        float yin = p0;
2405        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin);
2406        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2407        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2408        xin = p1;
2409        yin = p2;
2410        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin);
2411        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2412        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2413        xin = p0;
2414        yin = p1;
2415        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin);
2416        final float result = (a + b + c) * F3f;
2417        final float sharp = foamSharpness * 2.2f;
2418        final float diff = 0.5f - result;
2419        final int sign = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(diff) >> 31, one = sign | 1;
2420        return (((one * 0.5f - sign) * (result + sign)) / (Float.MIN_VALUE - sign + (result + sharp * diff) * one) - sign) * 2f - 1f;
2421    }
2422
2423    public float getFoamFractal(float x, float y) {
2424        x *= frequency;
2425        y *= frequency;
2426
2427        switch (fractalType) {
2428            case FBM:
2429                return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y);
2430            case BILLOW:
2431                return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y);
2432            case RIDGED_MULTI:
2433                return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
2434            default:
2435                return 0;
2436        }
2437    }
2438
2439    private float singleFoamFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
2440        int seed = this.seed;
2441        float sum = singleFoam(seed, x, y);
2442        float amp = 1, t;
2443
2444        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2445            t = x;
2446            x = y * lacunarity;
2447            y = t * lacunarity;
2448
2449            amp *= gain;
2450            sum += singleFoam(seed + i, x, y) * amp;
2451        }
2452
2453        return sum * fractalBounding;
2454    }
2455
2456    private float singleFoamFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
2457        int seed = this.seed;
2458        float sum = Math.abs(singleFoam(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
2459        float amp = 1, t;
2460
2461        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2462            t = x;
2463            x = y * lacunarity;
2464            y = t * lacunarity;
2465
2466            amp *= gain;
2467            sum += (Math.abs(singleFoam(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2468        }
2469
2470        return sum * fractalBounding;
2471    }
2472
2473    private float singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
2474        int seed = this.seed;
2475        float t;
2476        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
2477        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2478            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleFoam(seed + i, x, y));
2479            correction += (exp *= 0.5);
2480            sum += spike * exp;
2481            t = x;
2482            x = y * lacunarity;
2483            y = t * lacunarity;
2484        }
2485        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
2486    }

2558    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y, float z){
2559        final float p0 = x;
2560        final float p1 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * 0.9428090415820634f;
2561        final float p2 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * -0.4714045207910317f + z * 0.816496580927726f;
2562        final float p3 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * -0.4714045207910317f + z * -0.816496580927726f;
2563
2564        float xin = p3;
2565        float yin = p2;
2566        float zin = p0;
2567        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin);
2568        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2569        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2570        xin = p0;
2571        yin = p1;
2572        zin = p3;
2573        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin);
2574        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2575        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2576        xin = p1;
2577        yin = p2;
2578        zin = p3;
2579        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin);
2580        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2581        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2582        xin = p0;
2583        yin = p1;
2584        zin = p2;
2585        final float d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin);
2586
2587        final float result = (a + b + c + d) * 0.25f;
2588        final float sharp = foamSharpness * 3.3f;
2589        final float diff = 0.5f - result;
2590        final int sign = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(diff) >> 31, one = sign | 1;
2591        return (((one * 0.5f - sign) * (result + sign)) / (Float.MIN_VALUE - sign + (result + sharp * diff) * one) - sign) * 2f - 1f;
2592
2593    }

2674        zin = p3;

2775    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
2776        final float p0 = x *  0.8157559148337911f + y *  0.5797766823136037f;
2777        final float p1 = x * -0.7314923478726791f + y *  0.6832997137249108f;
2778        final float p2 = x * -0.0208603044412437f + y * -0.3155296974329846f + z * 0.9486832980505138f;
2779        final float p3 = x * -0.0208603044412437f + y * -0.3155296974329846f + z * -0.316227766016838f + w *   0.8944271909999159f;
2780        final float p4 = x * -0.0208603044412437f + y * -0.3155296974329846f + z * -0.316227766016838f + w * -0.44721359549995804f + u *  0.7745966692414833f;
2781        final float p5 = x * -0.0208603044412437f + y * -0.3155296974329846f + z * -0.316227766016838f + w * -0.44721359549995804f + u * -0.7745966692414836f;
2782
2783        float xin = p1;
2784        float yin = p2;
2785        float zin = p3;
2786        float win = p4;
2787        float uin = p5;
2788        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin, win, uin);
2789        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2790        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2791        xin = p0;
2792        yin = p2;
2793        zin = p3;
2794        win = p4;
2795        uin = p5;
2796        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin, win, uin);
2797        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2798        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2799        xin = p0;
2800        yin = p1;
2801        zin = p3;
2802        win = p4;
2803        uin = p5;
2804        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin, win, uin);
2805        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2806        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2807        xin = p0;
2808        yin = p1;
2809        zin = p2;
2810        win = p4;
2811        uin = p5;
2812        final float d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin, win, uin);
2813        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2814        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2815        xin = p0;
2816        yin = p1;
2817        zin = p2;
2818        win = p3;
2819        uin = p5;
2820        final float e = valueNoise(seed, xin + d, yin, zin, win, uin);
2821        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2822        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2823        xin = p0;
2824        yin = p1;
2825        zin = p2;
2826        win = p3;
2827        uin = p4;
2828        final float f = valueNoise(seed, xin + e, yin, zin, win, uin);
2829
2830        final float result = (a + b + c + d + e + f) * 0.16666666666666666f;
2831        final float sharp = foamSharpness * 5.5f;
2832        final float diff = 0.5f - result;
2833        final int sign = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(diff) >> 31, one = sign | 1;
2834        return (((one * 0.5f - sign) * (result + sign)) / (Float.MIN_VALUE - sign + (result + sharp * diff) * one) - sign) * 2f - 1f;

2836    }

2996    public float getPerlinFractal(float x, float y) {
2997        x *= frequency;
2998        y *= frequency;
2999
3000        switch (fractalType) {
3001            case FBM:
3002                return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
3003            case BILLOW:
3004                return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
3005            case RIDGED_MULTI:
3006                return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
3007            default:

3012    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
3013        int seed = this.seed;
3014        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y);
3015        float amp = 1;
3016
3017        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3018            x *= lacunarity;
3019            y *= lacunarity;
3020
3021            amp *= gain;
3022            sum += singlePerlin(++seed, x, y) * amp;
3023        }
3024
3025        return sum * fractalBounding;
3026    }

3028    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
3029        int seed = this.seed;
3030        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
3031        float amp = 1;
3032
3033        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3034            if(fractalSpiral){
3035                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
3036                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
3037                x = x2; y = y2;
3038            }
3039            x *= lacunarity;
3040            y *= lacunarity;
3041
3042            amp *= gain;
3043            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
3044        }
3045
3046        return sum * fractalBounding;
3047    }

3049    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
3050        int seed = this.seed;
3051        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
3052        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
3053            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y));
3054            correction += (exp *= 0.5);
3055            sum += spike * exp;
3056            if(fractalSpiral){
3057                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
3058                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
3059                x = x2; y = y2;
3060            }
3061            x *= lacunarity;
3062            y *= lacunarity;
3063        }
3064        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
3065    }

3071    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y) {
3072        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
3073        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
3074        int x1 = x0 + 1;
3075        int y1 = y0 + 1;
3076
3077        float xs, ys;
3078        switch (interpolation) {
3079            default:
3080            case LINEAR:
3081                xs = x - x0;
3082                ys = y - y0;
3083                break;
3084            case HERMITE:
3085                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
3086                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
3087                break;
3088            case QUINTIC:
3089                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
3090                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
3091                break;
3092        }
3093
3094        float xd0 = x - x0;
3095        float yd0 = y - y0;
3096        float xd1 = xd0 - 1;
3097        float yd1 = yd0 - 1;
3098
3099        float xf0 = lerp(gradCoord2D(seed, x0, y0, xd0, yd0), gradCoord2D(seed, x1, y0, xd1, yd0), xs);
3100        float xf1 = lerp(gradCoord2D(seed, x0, y1, xd0, yd1), gradCoord2D(seed, x1, y1, xd1, yd1), xs);
3101
3102        return lerp(xf0, xf1, ys);
3103    }

3448
3449        return lerp(wf0, wf1, us) * 0.7777777f;
3450    }
3451    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
3452        int seed = this.seed;
3453        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u);
3454        float amp = 1;
3455
3456        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3457            x *= lacunarity;
3458            y *= lacunarity;
3459            z *= lacunarity;
3460            w *= lacunarity;
3461            u *= lacunarity;
3462
3463            amp *= gain;
3464            sum += singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u) * amp;
3465        }
3466
3467        return sum * fractalBounding;
3468    }
3469
3470    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
3471        int seed = this.seed;
3472        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1;
3473        float amp = 1;
3474
3475        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3476            if(fractalSpiral){
3477                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3478                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3479                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3480                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3481                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3482                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
3483            }
3484            x *= lacunarity;
3485            y *= lacunarity;
3486            z *= lacunarity;
3487            w *= lacunarity;
3488            u *= lacunarity;
3489
3490            amp *= gain;
3491            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
3492        }
3493
3494        return sum * fractalBounding;
3495    }
3496
3497    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
3498        int seed = this.seed;
3499        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
3500        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
3501            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u));
3502            correction += (exp *= 0.5);
3503            sum += spike * exp;
3504            if(fractalSpiral){
3505                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3506                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3507                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3508                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3509                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3510                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
3511            }
3512            x *= lacunarity;
3513            y *= lacunarity;
3514            z *= lacunarity;
3515            w *= lacunarity;
3516            u *= lacunarity;
3517        }
3518        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
3519    }

3529    public float getPerlin(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
3530        return singlePerlin(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency, v * frequency);
3531    }
3532
3533    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
3534        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
3535        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
3536        int z0 = fastFloor(z);
3537        int w0 = fastFloor(w);
3538        int u0 = fastFloor(u);
3539        int v0 = fastFloor(v);
3540        int x1 = x0 + 1;
3541        int y1 = y0 + 1;
3542        int z1 = z0 + 1;
3543        int w1 = w0 + 1;
3544        int u1 = u0 + 1;
3545        int v1 = v0 + 1;
3546
3547        float xs, ys, zs, ws, us, vs;
3548        switch (interpolation) {
3549            default:
3550            case LINEAR:
3551                xs = x - x0;
3552                ys = y - y0;
3553                zs = z - z0;
3554                ws = w - w0;
3555                us = u - u0;
3556                vs = v - v0;
3557                break;
3558            case HERMITE:
3559                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
3560                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
3561                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
3562                ws = hermiteInterpolator(w - w0);
3563                us = hermiteInterpolator(u - u0);
3564                vs = hermiteInterpolator(v - v0);
3565                break;
3566            case QUINTIC:
3567                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
3568                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
3569                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);
3570                ws = quinticInterpolator(w - w0);
3571                us = quinticInterpolator(u - u0);
3572                vs = quinticInterpolator(v - v0);
3573                break;
3574        }
3575
3576        final float xd0 = x - x0;
3577        final float yd0 = y - y0;
3578        final float zd0 = z - z0;
3579        final float wd0 = w - w0;
3580        final float ud0 = u - u0;
3581        final float vd0 = v - v0;
3582        final float xd1 = xd0 - 1;
3583        final float yd1 = yd0 - 1;
3584        final float zd1 = zd0 - 1;
3585        final float wd1 = wd0 - 1;
3586        final float ud1 = ud0 - 1;
3587        final float vd1 = vd0 - 1;
